intro: Platycarpum decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive flat-fruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and evolution.
